question.title: What is typically seen on an electrocardiogram (ECG) of acute pericarditis?
question.description: The ECG finding in acute pericarditis

option_a.title: ST elevation without reciprocal changes
option_a.description: A common ECG finding in acute pericarditis

option_b.title: PR segment depression
option_b.description: A common ECG finding in acute pericarditis

option_c.title: Left axis deviation
option_c.description: A common ECG finding in acute pericarditis

option_d.title: Bundle branch block
option_d.description: A common ECG finding in acute pericarditis
